label: 御霊会
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: The Sacred Spirit Service, a rite to appease pestilence gods and the calamity-producing angry spirits of notable humans, was usually associated with Gion Shrine east of the capital, where it was performed each year on the Fourteenth or Fifteenth of the Sixth Month.  It included a comic dance by thin men" (hosootoko) wearing rectangular cloth masks (p. 652n). [祇園社、細男]"
